In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's an example of a function `wrap_string` in Julia that iterates over words and adds a new line each time the maximum `text_width::Int=10` is exceeded:
```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int=10)
    result = ""
    for word in split(str)
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        end
        result *= word
    end
    return result
end
```
You can call this function by passing a string and an optional `text_width` argument. For example:
```julia
str = "This is a sample string."
result = wrap_string(str) # returns "This\nis\na\nsample\nstring."
result = wrap_string(str, 8) # returns "This is\na sample\nstring."
```
